page.title: 09DALZIEL FLYING CLUB
page.content: The Pigeon-Fanciers Club in Bellshill Road, Known as the{Dalziel Flying Club was founded in 1922. The club has 36 members, known as{Lofts,}the oldest of whom, Mr Clark, is 87 years of age. The pigeons shortest race is 66 miles but the longest has been 602 miles from Nantes in France. When pigeons are racing they do not know where they are going and sometimes get lost! During training sessions they fly for short distances, eg from Lesmahagow or Wishaw back home to Motherwell. Good birds can fly at 70 miles per hour. Both male and female pigeons are raced. It is safe to start racing pigeons when they are 12 weeks old. They are transported to the race start in baskets by road and rail. The winner of the race is the pigeon who gets home first.
